alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Lewis; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 2:26AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of southwestern Randolph, southwestern Pocahontas, Nicholas, southeastern Lewis, eastern Braxton, southern Upshur, Webster and eastern Fayette Counties through 315 AM EDT... At 225 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of gusty showers extending from 7 miles west of Rock Cave to 7 miles east of Piney View. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Summersville, Richwood, Rainelle, Babcock State Park, Webster Springs, Addison (Webster Springs), Mill Creek, Camden-On-gauley, Birch River, Craigsville, Holly River State Park, Camden On Gauley, Rock Cave, Cowen, Meadow Bridge, Flatwoods, Womelsdorf (Coalton), Thurmond, Alexander and Eden. This includes Route 19 between mile markers 27 and 65. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
